description: How do you learn d3.js? — Medium
extended: I’ve been thinking quite a bit about how people learn d3.js, I don’t mean technical mastery of a useful library, I mean learning the craft enabled by a new tool. Creating data visualizations with d3.

description: www.nytimes.com
extended: Eva S. Moskowitz defended her Success Academy charter schools on Friday, two days after a group of parents filed a federal complaint accusing the network of discriminating against students with disabilities.

description: NowThis - Activist Who Held Longest Peaceful Protest In... | Facebook
Young Thug Talks About His Eclectic Style: "Simple Minded People Don't Understand" | Complex
extended: Young Thug recently sat down with Sway Calloway to discuss his personal style. The rapper not only touched on his unique style when it comes to music, but also his forward-thinking approach towards fashion and the people who don't quite get it.

description: Woody Guthrie, 'Old Man Trump' and a real estate empire's racist foundations
extended: In December 1950, Woody Guthrie signed his name to the lease of a new apartment in Brooklyn. Even now, over half a century later, that uninspiring document prompts a double-take.

description: The Stoned Immaculate: Meet the Weed Nuns of the San Joaquin Valley | VICE | Canada
extended: Last October, California Governor Jerry Brown signed the Medical Marijuana Regulation and Safety Act into law, requiring local jurisdictions to develop their own marijuana regulations by March 1, 2016, or relinquish authority to the state government.

description: You Don't Throw a Basketball, So Why Is It Called a Free Throw? A VICE Sports Investigation | VICE Sports
extended: Welcome. After reading this, you're either going to think the next few minutes of your life were a quirky digression into curious basketball trivia, or you're going to scream that you've just wasted two minutes of your life and you want them back.

description: Hezbollah May Come Out of the Syrian Civil War Stronger Than Ever | War Is Boring
extended: When Sheikh Hassan Nasrallah confirmed in May 2013 that Hezbollah had joined the Syrian Civil War on the side of Pres. Bashar Al Assad’s embattled government, it marked a major political and military shift for the Lebanese Shi’ite militia.

description: Breaking the Chains of Command: Anarchist Veterans of the US Military, by Brad Thomson | Institute for Anarchist Studies
extended: This piece appears in the current issue of Perspectives on Anarchist Theory, N. 28, on Justice available from AK Press here. Brad received an Institute for Anarchist Studies writing grant to assist in the completion of this piece.

description: A Psychoanalyst Explains Why Men Draw Dicks on Everything | Broadly
extended: As a woman, I can't quite classify my relationship to the penis, drawn. On a subconscious level, the scrawled outline of a phallus is instinctively as amusing to me as it is a symbol of threateningly unchecked masculinity.

description: Guy Accidentally Books A Private Jet - Digg
extended: 14 diggs Funny Aviation World It would appear that not many people wanted to fly from Manila to Boracay, because Alex Simon got the whole plane to himself.

description: Video: Artist Pamela Z makes music with a wave of her hand | Fusion
Exclusive - DeRay Mckesson Extended Interview Video - January 26, 2016 | Comedy Central
Watch the First Trailer for 'GAYCATION' with Ellen Page and Ian Daniel | VICE | United Kingdom
extended: On February 29, VICE will launch our new TV channel, VICELAND – a 24-hour cable channel featuring hundreds of hours of new programming. It's been a lot of work, but we've had help from some insanely talented people and we can't wait to share our first lineup of shows with you.

description: We Asked a Philosopher Whether or Not It’s OK to Do Drugs | VICE | United States
extended: Peg O' Connor has made thinking about drugs her life's work.

description: What I learned about Trump from bingeing The Apprentice | Fusion
extended: Back in 2004, a television show helped remake Donald Trump’s career. It was called The Apprentice, and it was a huge hit. Before the The Apprentice, Trump was essentially a local New York City celebrity.
